info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 3:41PM EDT until July 07 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL CALEDONIA COUNTY... At 341 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... St. Johnsbury, Lyndon, Danville, Walden, Barnet, Stannard, Peacham, Wheelock, North Danville, Greenbank Hollow, West Danville and East Peacham. Most affected areas are in the headwaters of the Passumpsic River Basin, particularly in the Danville and North Danville areas and Sleepers River watershed. These small tributaries will rise rapidly in the next few hours, leading to a higher threat of flash flooding. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
